meanings.sent1: The students attended a preparatory class to get ready for the exam.
meanings.sent2: She made a preparatory list of things to pack for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat's preparatory stretching before pouncing on the toy was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were a preparatory warning of the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The chef's careful and preparatory chopping of vegetables made the dish delicious.

meanings.definition: Something done in preparation for something else
meanings.sent1: The checklist was a helpful preparatory for the big event.
meanings.sent2: He completed the preparatory tasks before starting the main project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's preparatory gathering of nuts was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The early morning sunrise was a beautiful preparatory for the day.
meanings.sent5: The team meeting served as a crucial preparatory for the upcoming presentation.

meanings.definition: A school or course designed to prepare students for a higher level of education
meanings.sent1: She enrolled in a preparatory school to improve her academic skills.
meanings.sent2: The preparatory course helped students transition smoothly to college.
meanings.sent3: The clown's preparatory juggling class was both fun and educational.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers were a colorful preparatory for the graduation ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The preparatory program offered intensive training for the entrance exam.
